results.title: Mice and how they live
results.brief_description: Cactus mice are used to indicate typical behaviour of mice, but this species is atypical in that it does not need to drink. Close-up photography is used to reveal habitat, food, physical description and behaviour of mice. English verion of German motion picture.
results.description: Cactus mice are used to indicate typical behaviour of mice, but this species is atypical in that it does not need to drink. Close-up photography is used to reveal habitat, food, physical description and behaviour of mice. English verion of German motion picture.

results.title: Frogs and how they live
results.brief_description: Uses close-up photography toreveal key concepts about this familiar amphibian. The process of metamorphosis, hibernation and details of major body parts are also shown. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Empirical formula by micro-analysis
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Shows procedures necessary to determine the empirical formula of a substance. Amounts of carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen are determined by estimating the weight of CO2, H2O and NH3 produced by the unknown. Students are expected to record the data and use it to ascertain the formula. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Two little frosts
results.brief_description: An animated story in the style of a folk tale in which man is pitted against the elements. The personified frost creatures assume that an old man will fall easily prey to their ability to freeze. Despite all their efforts, the experienced woodman unknowingly defeats the two little frosts.

results.title: Mouse-activated candle lighter
results.creator_credit: Prism Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The mouse-activated candle lighter illustrates various forms of potential and kinetic energy. It is made from a mousetrap, fishing rod, alarm clock, ice-pack, train motor, rubberband, match and candle. Students are challenged to find the many forms of energy hidden in the mechanism and their movements. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Wonders of growing plants. - 2nd. ed.
results.brief_description: Two children plant lima beans in a glass with blotting paper that soaks up water to keep the seeds moist. Time-lapse photography is used to show the growth of the plants. Other methods of growing plants, such as from roots, stems and leaves are shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Where is dead?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Lifestyle Productions
results.brief_description:
A low-keyed drama which deals compassionately with a subject that children sometimes have to face, the death of someone they love. When six-year-old Sarah’s older brother dies suddenly, her parents must explain to her what has happened and help her cope with her feelings.
Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Vanished vikings. Part 2: Where did they go?
results.creator_credit: Edwin Morrisby, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In the 16th century European explorers found no Viking settlements in Greenland - only bones and ruins. This film introduces the leading theories about the sudden disappearance of some 9000 Viking people and follows the points of view of leading scholars. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Tomorrow's quake
results.creator_credit: Lewis C. Hall and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film explores efforts to develop hypotheses on earthquake prediction. Explains continental drift, dilatency, plate techtonics, earthquake mechanics, seismographs, P and S waves, Seismic velocity changes, tilimeters, ground elevation, water wells and unusual animal behaviour.

results.title: Sports for life
results.brief_description: Discusses reasons for taking up sport, such as the value of exercise for physical health, the development of self reliance and self discipline, a relaxation and break from work and the development of cooperation through the participation in team sports.
